title: Indian markets closed on Thursday, Friday for public holidays
text:
March 29, 2018 / 4:33 AM / Updated 43 minutes ago Indian markets closed on Thursday, Friday for public holidays Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MUMBAI (Reuters) - Indiaâ€™s stocks, bonds and currency markets are closed on Thursday and Friday for public holidays. Trading will resume on Monday. A broker reacts while trading at his computer terminal at a stock brokerage firm in Mumbai, February 26, 2016. REUTERS/Shailesh Andrade/Files 
The broader NSE Nifty fell 0.69 percent to 10,113.70 on Wednesday, while the benchmark BSE Sensex lost 0.62 percent to 32,968.68. 
The benchmark 10-year bond yield rose about 7 basis points to 7.40 percent, while the rupee weakened to 65.17 from its 64.98 close. Reporting by Vishal Sridhar in Bengaluru; Editing by Biju Dwarakanath
